      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> appCategory(java.lang.String startDate, java.lang.String endDate)
      This method calculates and assigns the usageTime relevant to each appCategory inside a LinkedHashMap, which is then returned.
      java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> diurnalPattern(java.lang.String startDate, java.lang.String endDate, java.lang.String school, java.lang.String gender, java.lang.String year, java.lang.String cca)
      This method calculates and assigns the usageTime for every hour in the particular day entered by the user, then returns it as a LinkedHashMap, where the key is the start hour to the end hour as a String, and the Object as the usageTime occurred by all users within that period.
      java.lang.String[] usageTimeCategory(java.lang.String startDate, java.lang.String endDate)
      This Method takes in the start Date and end Date entered by the user and calculates and assigns every user to a type of user depending on its usageTime

      This Method takes in the start date and end date as entered by the user, as well as 4 possible sort filters, whether or not they are entered by the user.

    • Method Detail

      • usageTimeCategory

        public java.lang.String[] usageTimeCategory(java.lang.String startDate,
                                            java.lang.String endDate)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
        This Method takes in the start Date and end Date entered by the user and calculates and assigns every user to a type of user depending on its usageTime
        Parameters:
        startDate - Start Date entered by the user
        endDate - End Date entered by the user
        Returns:
        a String Array, else null if there is no record
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - when there is input or output errors

      • appCategory

        public java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> appCategory(java.lang.String startDate,
                                                                              java.lang.String endDate)
                                                                       throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                                                                              java.io.IOException
        This method calculates and assigns the usageTime relevant to each appCategory inside a LinkedHashMap, which is then returned.
        Parameters:
        startDate - start date
        endDate - end date
        Returns:
        a LinkedHashMap of usage time with app category as the key
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException - defines a general exception a servlet can throw when it encounters difficulty.
        java.io.IOException - when there are input or output errors

      • diurnalPattern

        public java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> diurnalPattern(java.lang.String startDate,
                                                                                  java.lang.String endDate,
                                                                                  java.lang.String school,
                                                                                  java.lang.String gender,
                                                                                  java.lang.String year,
                                                                                  java.lang.String cca)
                                                                           throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                                                                                  java.io.IOException
        This method calculates and assigns the usageTime for every hour in the particular day entered by the user, then returns it as a LinkedHashMap, where the key is the start hour to the end hour as a String, and the Object as the usageTime occurred by all users within that period.
        Parameters:
        startDate - start date
        endDate - end date
        school - school
        cca - cca
        gender - gender
        year - year
        Returns:
        a LinkedHashMap of usage time with time period as the key
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException - defines a general exception a servlet can throw when it encounters difficulty.
        java.io.IOException - when there are input or output errors

      • usageTimeCategoryDemo

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String[]> usageTimeCategoryDemo(java.lang.String startDate,
                                                                     java.lang.String endDate,
                                                                     java.lang.String firstSort,
                                                                     java.lang.String secondSort,
                                                                     java.lang.String thirdSort,
                                                                     java.lang.String fourthSort,
                                                                     boolean isJson)
                                                              throws javax.servlet.ServletException,
                                                                     java.io.IOException
        This Method takes in the start date and end date as entered by the user, as well as 4 possible sort filters, whether or not they are entered by the user. the default value for this 4 filters is the string value "null".
        Parameters:
        isJson - when the method call is from json or web servlet
        startDate - Start Date entered by the user
        endDate - End Date entered by the user
        firstSort - 1st filter selected by the user, "null" string if none
        secondSort - 2nd filter selected by the user, "null" string if none
        thirdSort - 3rd filter selected by the user, "null" string if none
        fourthSort - 4th filter selected by the user, "null" string if none
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of String Arrays of Data to be displayed, or an empty ArrayList if there is no records from the database, or null if there is an Exception.
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException - defines a general exception a servlet can throw when it encounters difficulty.
        java.io.IOException - when there are input or output errors
